examples: As sunlight travels from one layer to another, the light refracts, or bends, just a teeny tiny bit.
Its dense material causes the light to refract.
Light enters tiny water droplets, bends or refracts, bounces, bends again, and different colors end up in your eye.
But once the ray reaches the interface between the glass and the air on the other side, it refracts again, and now the angle of refraction is equal to that first incident angle.
This bent sunlight then reflects off the back of the raindrop, and refracts again on the way out.
That bit of time is called a refractory period.
The device sends pulses through your vagus nerve, and this procedure was originally approved for treatment refractory epilepsy and then later on for depression.
This is called the refractory period, and it’s there to help prevent signals from traveling in both directions down the axon at once.
words.defineEn: stubbornly resistant to authority or control
words.defineVi: ngoan cố chống lại chính quyền hoặc kiểm soát

examples: Hence the common refrain: correlation doesn’t imply causation.
That is a refrain Gauthier has heard before.
By now, we’ve all heard the refrain that one of the biggest issues with the current state of education in the U.S. is overtesting.
You may refrain from talking about your feelings and exposing your vulnerability to people.
A common refrain from critics has been that the DPA hasn't been used enough and that it wasn't used soon enough.
words.defineVi: chống lại việc làm gì đó

examples: His bass baritone voice filled churches and opera houses alike, and he would sing whenever and wherever he had the chance.
You know, one of the things you do in the movie in addition to, you know, playing the music and singing it is that you have in the movie, his deep baritone.
words.defineEn: lower in range than tenor and higher than bass
words.defineVi: thấp hơn trong phạm vi so với tenor và cao hơn so với bass

examples: Watch out basses.
He plays the bass.
These have pretty deep bass.
I can feel the bass.
The default sound signature pumps the bass a little bit, but really not a ton.
words.defineEn: having or denoting a low vocal or instrumental range
words.defineVi: có hoặc biểu thị một giọng hát hoặc nhạc cụ thấp

words.defineEn: not permitting extrication; incapable of being disentangled or untied
words.defineVi: không cho phép khai thác; không thể tháo gỡ hoặc cởi trói

examples: But these kill switches are not infallible.
That does not mean that, like any research, the results are infallible.
Because lots of religions have an infallible leader, make promises of a faith based community, and encourage you to enmesh your personality with that of the larger group.
So, to reiterate, no newspaper or news site is infallible.
But nature isn’t infallible, and there’s all kinds of stuff out there that’s natural, but will also super kill you.
words.defineEn: incapable of being wrong, making mistakes, or failing
words.defineVi: không có khả năng sai, phạm sai lầm, hoặc thất bại

examples: This person is extremely inflexible in his thinking.
Basically, farmers are up against an inflexible food supply chain, which is specialized for the end customer.
They're urgent because they have inflexible deadlines.
It’s only when traits get really rigid and people become inflexible in their behaviors that psychologists start to draw the line between a trait and a disorder.
And number four: Is overconscientious scrupulous, and inflexible about matters of morality, ethics, or values.
words.defineEn: (of a rule, opinion, etc.) fixed and not easily changed
words.defineVi: (của một quy tắc, quan điểm, v.v.) cố định và không dễ thay đổi

examples: Blue cheese and bacon make an irresistible combination in a creamy spinach salad.
The combination of tender shredded chicken and sun-dried tomatoes made the pappardelle pasta dish simply irresistible.
They are irresistible.
It's just an irresistible fantasy that all drivers have had.
Living out at sea, the Sirens have an irresistible song that lures sailors to their death.
words.defineEn: impossible to resist or refuse, usually because of being very appealing or attractive
words.defineVi: không thể cưỡng lại hoặc từ chối, thường là vì rất hấp dẫn hoặc hấp dẫn

words.defineEn: hesitant and uncertain about what to do
words.defineVi: do dự và không chắc chắn về những gì phải làm

examples: It was so irresponsible of him to leave his children in the car all alone.
I was just irresponsible with everything else after that.
And it's not just irresponsible.
If you eat Pacific bluefin, not specifically from Japan, then that's really irresponsible.
This is the result of irresponsible policies.
words.defineEn: (of a person) not showing or having a good judgment incapable of handling assignments or taking responsibility of any kind
words.defineVi: (của một người) không thể hiện hoặc có khả năng phán đoán tốt, không có khả năng xử lý các nhiệm vụ hoặc chịu trách nhiệm dưới bất kỳ hình thức nào

examples: We can survive harsh winters, irrigate deserts, and travel at will to reach the most remote islands.
Trees need to be planted in the right soil conditions, inoculated with truffle fungus, and often irrigated constantly.
And, they also track strange things, like income because wealthy people have the money to irrigate and manicure their lawns in a place in a way that more impoverished folks don't.
A year are used to irrigate Nearby Crops.
Under the Maurya Empire, more than half of the arable land in ancient India was irrigated, producing two harvests a year.
words.defineEn: (of crops, land, etc.) to supply with water, typically by artificial means
words.defineVi: (của cây trồng, đất đai, v.v.) để cung cấp nước, thường bằng phương tiện nhân tạo

examples: Despite her best efforts to be kind and compassionate, her innate selfishness couldn't be suppressed, proving that what is bred in the bone will come out in the flesh.
It is at least partially innate.
As humans, we have an innate attraction to nature.
- People have these innate reactions when they see creepy crawly things.
This is your body’s innate immune system at work.
words.defineEn: not established by conditioning or learning
words.defineVi: không được thiết lập bởi điều kiện hoặc học tập
nằm hoặc xảy ra xa nhất trong

examples: They infused hyssop in olive oil and used it as a natural remedy for skin irritations.
We harvested fresh dill seeds from our garden and used them to infuse a jar of homemade vinegar.
They harvested the marjoram leaves from their garden and used them to infuse oil for salad dressings.
She infused olive oil with rosemary and used it as a moisturizer for her skin.
He added slices of boerewors to his homemade pizza, infusing it with a unique and delicious flavor.
words.defineVi: trải qua quá trình tiêm truyền

examples: The herbalist recommended an anise infusion to soothe their upset stomach.
And this infusion of coral pigments gives the bleached coral a colorful hue.
Now tribal communities look forward to an infusion of resources.
We're going to get an infusion of money.
This cash infusion still may not result in inflation.
words.defineEn: the act of infusing or introducing a certain modifying element or quality
words.defineVi: hành động truyền hoặc giới thiệu một yếu tố hoặc chất lượng sửa đổi nhất định

words.defineEn: place in a grave or tomb
words.defineVi: đặt trong một ngôi mộ hoặc ngôi mộ
